fact: Did you know the Igala alphabet is made up of thirty-one (31) letters: some vowels, others consonants?
Did you know that the Igala alphabet was adopted from the English alphabet. The latter has five (5) vowels: “a,” “e,” “i,” “o,” “u.”?
Did you know that the Ígálá language has seven (7) vowels: “a,” “e,” “ẹ,” “i,” “o,” “ọ,” “u” (encompassing both all the 5 English vowels and two indigenous ones, ‘ẹ’ and  ‘ọ’).?
Did you know that igaladigital is the team behind this project?
Did You Know That Idah is Called Idah Alu Ogo Oja Abutu Eje?
